author: Office Of National Statistics

organization.description:
### Expenditure Data 

There are now several detailed datasets on Government expenditure available for the UK. The most significant are Council £500 spending, the Departmental £25k spending and the Combined Online Information System (COINS).

COINS is the primary database used by HMT for recording and analysing spending. It has a pseudo-double-entry structure and is the book of "prime entry" for the budget (planning spending) and forecasted outturn (what was actually spent).

A large sample of the COINS data is publicly available at data.gov.uk. We have gathered a variety of useful information to help interpret the COINS data:

 - [Package for COINS data itself including status of current access requests](http://www.ckan.net/package/coins-data)
 - [COINS schema and field definitions](http://www.ckan.net/package/ukgov-coins-field-definitions)

The reason that COINS is important to this project is because it contains the main high level reports on public spending and almost all other government reports on spending are directly derived from it including:

 - [Public Expenditure Statistical Analysis](http://www.ckan.net/package/ukgov-finances-pesa)
 - [Country Regional Analysis](http://www.ckan.net/package/ukgov-finances-cra)
 - [The Budget](http://www.ckan.net/package/ukgov-finance-budget)
 - [The Supplementary Budget Information](http://www.ckan.net/package/ukgov-finance-sbi)
 - [The Supply Estimates](http://www.ckan.net/package/ukgov-finance-main-supply-estimates)
 - Some of the [Office of National Statistics Blue Book](http://www.ckan.net/package/ukgov-finance-blue-book)
 - Some of the [Office of National Statistics Pink Book](http://www.ckan.net/package/ukgov-finance-pink-book)
 - [The Whole of Government Accounts](http://www.ckan.net/package/ukgov-finance-whole-of-government-accounts)

While COINS shows spending and income, we also have another dataset called the Country Regional Analysis (CRA) which shows where public spending has effect: package:ukgov-finance-cra.

### Income Data

The main package is:

 - [National income data from HMRC](http://www.ckan.net/package/hmrc-national-statistics-income-tax-and-personal-incomes)

### Additional Data

Although this isn't key data at the present it is also useful:

 - [Monthly DataBank reports of public spending](http://www.ckan.net/package/ukgov-finance-databank)   
 
[1] More details about the project -- which aims to visualise how the UK government spend public funds -- can be found at 
[Where Does My Money Go?](http://www.wheredoesmymoneygo.org/).
organization.title: Where Does My Money Go?
organization.name: wdmmg

name: ukgov-finance-blue-book
notes:
The key annual publication for National Accounts statistics and the essential data source for anyone concerned with macro-economic policies and studies.

The Blue Book provides detailed estimates of national product, income and expenditure for the UK. Some tables contain data for the last eighteen years; all tables contain data for the last nine years. It covers value added by industry, full accounts by sector - including financial and non-financial corporations, central and local government and households - and capital formation.

Provides annual figures including lower level of detail to first releases produced for preliminary, provisional and full quarterly estimates of national accounts.

Part 5 of the Blue Book is entitled "UK Environmental Accounts". This part contains the accounts of the value of fossil fuel supplies, the yearly emissions and energy use of different groups, from individuals through to agriculture to industry.
title: The Office of National Statistics -- Blue Book
